page.title: 09Farming in the Alford area
page.content: Farming is the most important industry in the area.Most are large mixed farms growing cereals and raising beef cattle.Falling demand for beef from the cost and health conscious house- wife has resulted in fewer cattle being raised. There is one dairy farm. Crops grown are spring and winter barley and wheat,oats,turnips,potatoes grass for hay and increasingly silage. This year some have grown oil seed rape,linseed and protein peas. A combination of these crops spreads the work more evenly through the year. Barley is the main crop. Some goes for seed, some for malting, some for animal feedstuffs and some to the EEC grain mountains.Modern machinery means a costly investment and fewer men are employed.
